chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: What advantage then hath the Jew? or what profit is there of circumcision?
items.plainText: What advantage then hath the Jew? or what profit is there of circumcision?

items.text: Much every way: chiefly, because that unto them were committed the oracles of God.
items.plainText: Much every way: chiefly, because that unto them were committed the oracles of God.

items.text: For what if some did not believe? shall their unbelief make the faith of God without effect?
items.plainText: For what if some did not believe? shall their unbelief make the faith of God without effect?

items.text: God forbid: yea, let God be true, but every man a liar; as it is written, That thou mightest be justified in thy sayings, and mightest overcome when thou art judged.
items.plainText: God forbid: yea, let God be true, but every man a liar; as it is written, That thou mightest be justified in thy sayings, and mightest overcome when thou art judged.

items.text: But if our unrighteousness commend the righteousness of God, what shall we say? Is God unrighteous who taketh vengeance? (I speak as a man)
items.plainText: But if our unrighteousness commend the righteousness of God, what shall we say? Is God unrighteous who taketh vengeance? (I speak as a man)

items.text: God forbid: for then how shall God judge the world?
items.plainText: God forbid: for then how shall God judge the world?

items.text: For if the truth of God hath more abounded through my lie unto his glory; why yet am I also judged as a sinner?
items.plainText: For if the truth of God hath more abounded through my lie unto his glory; why yet am I also judged as a sinner?

items.text: And not rather, (as we be slanderously reported, and as some affirm that we say,) Let us do evil, that good may come? whose damnation is just.
items.plainText: And not rather, (as we be slanderously reported, and as some affirm that we say,) Let us do evil, that good may come? whose damnation is just.

items.text: What then? are we better than they? No, in no wise: for we have before proved both Jews and Gentiles, that they are all under sin;
items.plainText: What then? are we better than they? No, in no wise: for we have before proved both Jews and Gentiles, that they are all under sin;

items.text: As it is written, There is none righteous, no, not one:
items.plainText: As it is written, There is none righteous, no, not one:

items.text: There is none that understandeth, there is none that seeketh after God.
items.plainText: There is none that understandeth, there is none that seeketh after God.

items.text: They are all gone out of the way, they are together become unprofitable; there is none that doeth good, no, not one.
items.plainText: They are all gone out of the way, they are together become unprofitable; there is none that doeth good, no, not one.

items.text: Their throat is an open sepulchre; with their tongues they have used deceit; the poison of asps is under their lips:
items.plainText: Their throat is an open sepulchre; with their tongues they have used deceit; the poison of asps is under their lips:

items.text: Whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness:
items.plainText: Whose mouth is full of cursing and bitterness:

items.text: Their feet are swift to shed blood:
items.plainText: Their feet are swift to shed blood:

items.text: Destruction and misery are in their ways:
items.plainText: Destruction and misery are in their ways:

items.text: And the way of peace have they not known:
items.plainText: And the way of peace have they not known:

items.text: There is no fear of God before their eyes.
items.plainText: There is no fear of God before their eyes.

items.text: Now we know that what things soever the law saith, it saith to them who are under the law: that every mouth may be stopped, and all the world may become guilty before God.
items.plainText: Now we know that what things soever the law saith, it saith to them who are under the law: that every mouth may be stopped, and all the world may become guilty before God.

items.text: Therefore by the deeds of the law there shall no flesh be justified in his sight: for by the law is the knowledge of sin.
items.plainText: Therefore by the deeds of the law there shall no flesh be justified in his sight: for by the law is the knowledge of sin.

items.text: But now the righteousness of God without the law is manifested, being witnessed by the law and the prophets;
items.plainText: But now the righteousness of God without the law is manifested, being witnessed by the law and the prophets;

items.text: Even the righteousness of God which is by faith of Jesus Christ unto all and upon all them that believe: for there is no difference:
items.plainText: Even the righteousness of God which is by faith of Jesus Christ unto all and upon all them that believe: for there is no difference:

items.text: For all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God;
items.plainText: For all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God;

items.text: Being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus:
items.plainText: Being justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus:

items.text: Whom God hath set forth to be a propitiation through faith in his blood, to declare his righteousness for the remission of sins that are past, through the forbearance of God;
items.plainText: Whom God hath set forth to be a propitiation through faith in his blood, to declare his righteousness for the remission of sins that are past, through the forbearance of God;

items.text: To declare, I say, at this time his righteousness: that he might be just, and the justifier of him which believeth in Jesus.
items.plainText: To declare, I say, at this time his righteousness: that he might be just, and the justifier of him which believeth in Jesus.

items.text: Where is boasting then? It is excluded. By what law? of works? Nay: but by the law of faith.
items.plainText: Where is boasting then? It is excluded. By what law? of works? Nay: but by the law of faith.

items.text: Therefore we conclude that a man is justified by faith without the deeds of the law.
items.plainText: Therefore we conclude that a man is justified by faith without the deeds of the law.

items.text: Is he the God of the Jews only? is he not also of the Gentiles? Yes, of the Gentiles also:
items.plainText: Is he the God of the Jews only? is he not also of the Gentiles? Yes, of the Gentiles also:

items.text: Seeing it is one God, which shall justify the circumcision by faith, and uncircumcision through faith.
items.plainText: Seeing it is one God, which shall justify the circumcision by faith, and uncircumcision through faith.

items.text: Do we then make void the law through faith? God forbid: yea, we establish the law.
items.plainText: Do we then make void the law through faith? God forbid: yea, we establish the law.
